entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 2:37PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...UNSEASONABLY STRONG STORM WILL IMPACT KODIAK ISLAND, THE KENAI PENINSULA, AND ANCHORAGE THIS WEEKEND... A strong storm system, more reminiscent of weather experienced in the Spring or Fall seasons, will track toward southern Alaska this weekend bringing widespread heavy rain and strong winds. Here are some of the expected impacts:
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage; Kodiak Island; Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 2:35PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...UNSEASONABLY STRONG STORM WILL BRING STRONG GUSTY WINDS TO BRISTOL BAY THROUGH SUNDAY... A strong storm system will bring strong and gusty winds to the Bristol Bay region late tonight through Sunday. The strongest winds are expected late tonight through Sunday morning. Here are some specific impacts:

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 3:22PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...INCREASING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH MONDAY... * Widespread showers and thunderstorms are expected through Monday, with a 50-80% chance for any given location to see a storm in the Sierra, northeast CA, and western Nevada. Storms will favor the afternoon and evening hours, with chances for showers to continue overnight.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 10 at 12:54PM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Pocatello has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Idaho... Big Lost River near Arco affecting Butte County. .Heavy, recent rainfall combined with high mountain snow have caused high inflows into the Mackay reservoir, which is prompting high releases downstream of the reservoir.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued June 10 at 12:17PM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Pocatello ID has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Idaho... Big Lost River below Mackay Reservoir affecting Custer County. .High mountain snowmelt and recent heavy rainfall has increased river flows upstream of the reservoir and has caused additional releases below the reservoir causing the river flows to become high.

entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...High waves and strong currents expected. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Door, Kewaunee and Manitowoc Counties. * WHEN...From 11 PM CDT this evening through Sunday evening.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued June 10 at 3:18PM CDT until June 12 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Life threatening waves of 3 to 6 feet and dangerous currents are expected. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Sheboygan, and Ozaukee counties.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued June 10 at 3:18PM CDT until June 12 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM CDT SUNDAY THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Life threatening waves of 4 to 8 feet and dangerous currents are expected. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Milwaukee, Racine, and Kenosha counties.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued June 10 at 3:26AM CDT until June 10 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM CDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous swimming conditions are expected along the Lake Superior shoreline due to high wave action and strong rip currents. * WHERE...Minnesota Park Point and Wisconsin Point Beaches.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 10 at 11:25AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Green River near La Barge affecting Lincoln and Sublette Counties. .High-elevation snowmelt continues and automated snowpack estimates reveal about 5 inches of water remaining in the snowpack in the mountains around 9,500 feet west of La Barge. Approximately 1 inch

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 10 at 11:14AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Bear River below Pixley Dam affecting Lincoln County. .High-elevation snowmelt, with snowpack remaining above 9,500 feet, continues.
